title: Authorizes the department of economic development and job development authority to provide pre-exporting assistance from the export trade revolving loan fund to firm
summary: Authorizes the department of economic development and the job development authority to provide pre-exporting assistance from an export trade revolving loan fund to small and medium size firms seeking to export from New York; directs the economic development commissioner to assist the job development authority to identify manufacturers eligible for assistance through such fund; includes financial assistance for export trade within definition of "project" for job development authority.

       AN ACT to amend the economic development law and the public  authorities
         law, in relation to authorizing the department of economic development

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-

    9    S  3. Title 8 of article 8 of the public authorities law is amended by
   10  adding a new subtitle 5-B to read as follows:
   11                                 SUBTITLE V-B
   12                      EXPORT TRADE REVOLVING LOAN FUND
   13  SECTION 1835-AA. STATEMENT OF LEGISLATIVE FINDINGS AND PURPOSE.
   14          1835-BB. DEFINITIONS.

   16          1835-DD. REPAYMENT OF LOANS.

   18    S 1835-AA. STATEMENT OF LEGISLATIVE FINDINGS AND PURPOSE. THE LEGISLA-
   19  TURE HEREBY FINDS AND DECLARES THAT  SMALL  AND  MEDIUM-SIZED  COMPANIES
   20  HAVE SOUGHT TO INCREASE THEIR SALES AND EMPLOYMENT BY ENTERING THE WORLD
   21  MARKET IN THAT THEY ARE DESIROUS OF MAKING INTERNATIONAL SALES. HOWEVER,
   22  SUCH  BUSINESS TRANSACTIONS ARE SUBSTANTIALLY MORE COMPLEX THAN A NORMAL
   23  DOMESTIC SALES RELATIONSHIP  FAMILIAR  TO  THE  UNITED  STATES  BUSINESS
   24  COMMUNITY.  FURTHER,  THE  INTERNATIONAL  SALE  REQUIRES A GREAT DEAL OF
   25  DOCUMENTATION, KNOWLEDGE OF FOREIGN MARKETS, HIGH  RISK  RELATIVE  TO  A
   26  DOMESTIC  SALE,  SPECIAL FREIGHT FORWARDING TRANSACTION, AND MOST IMPOR-
   27  TANTLY, SPECIAL FINANCING.
   28    THE LEGISLATURE FURTHER FINDS AND DECLARES THAT SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED
   29  MANUFACTURERS REQUIRE SHORT-TERM FINANCING WHICH IS CURRENTLY NOT AVAIL-
   30  ABLE THROUGHOUT THE STATE OF  NEW  YORK  FOR  ACTIVITIES  THAT  MUST  BE
   31  COMPLETED  PRIOR TO THE FOREIGN SALE OF GOODS KNOWN AS PRE-EXPORT ACTIV-
   32  ITIES. THEREFORE, TO HELP BUSINESS IN THIS STATE TO  BETTER  EXPORT  ITS
   33  PRODUCTS,  THE  LEGISLATURE  DESIRES  THAT THE JOB DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY
   34  PROVIDE LOANS TO SMALL AND MEDIUM-SIZED  COMPANIES  THROUGH  APPROPRIATE
   35  AND  EFFICIENT  METHODS SO THAT MORE BUSINESSES IN THE STATE OF NEW YORK
   36  MAY ENTER THE INTERNATIONAL SALES MARKETPLACE.
   37    S 1835-BB. DEFINITIONS. AS USED IN THIS SUBTITLE:
   38    1. "AGREEMENT" MEANS AN EXPORT TRADE LOAN AGREEMENT MADE  PURSUANT  TO
   39  THIS SUBTITLE.
   40    2.  "AUTHORITY" MEANS THE JOB DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY CREATED BY SECTION
   41  EIGHTEEN HUNDRED TWO OF THIS TITLE.
   42    3. "EXPORT TRADING ENTITY" MEANS A PERSON, FIRM,  PARTNERSHIP,  CORPO-
   43  RATION  OR  OTHER ENTITY, PRINCIPALLY DOING BUSINESS IN THE STATE OF NEW
   44  YORK, WITH FEWER THAN ONE HUNDRED EMPLOYEES, ENGAGED IN  OR  SEEKING  TO
   45  ENGAGE IN AN ELIGIBLE PROJECT.
   46    4.  "ELIGIBLE  PROJECT"  MEANS  PRE-EXPORT  ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED BY AN
   47  EXPORT TRADING ENTITY, ENGAGED IN ACTIVITIES  INVOLVING  THE  EXPORT  OF
   48  GOODS  AND  SERVICES,  INCLUDING  BUT  NOT  LIMITED  TO  MARKET SURVEYS,
   49  RESEARCH, PRODUCT SOURCING, MARKETING, ADVERTISING,  BONDING,  INSURING,
   50  WAREHOUSING,  SHIPPING,  STORAGE,  DOCUMENTATION, EXPORT MARKET DEVELOP-
   51  MENT, EXPERT ADVICE AND TRADE SHOWS.
   52    5. "BORROWER" MEANS ANY ENTITY WHICH RECEIVES A LOAN UNDER THIS SUBTI-
   53  TLE TO PARTICIPATE IN AN ELIGIBLE PROJECT.
   54    6. "PROJECT COST" INCLUDES ALL REASONABLE AND NECESSARY  COSTS  TO  BE
   55  INCURRED  WHILE  COMPLETING AN ELIGIBLE PROJECT, INCLUDING LEGAL, FINAN-
   56  CIAL, INSURANCE AND EXPORT TRADING SERVICES.

       A. 2832                             3

    1    S 1835-CC. ADDITIONAL POWERS OF THE  AUTHORITY.  THE  AUTHORITY  SHALL
    2  HAVE THE POWER AND DUTY TO:
    3    1.  ASSIST  AND COUNSEL EXPORT TRADING ENTITIES IN THEIR DEALINGS WITH
    4  FEDERAL, STATE AND LOCAL  GOVERNMENTS,  INCLUDING  BUT  NOT  LIMITED  TO
    5  PROVIDING   ACCESS  TO  INFORMATION  REGARDING  GOVERNMENT  REQUIREMENTS
    6  AFFECTING EXPORT TRADING ACTIVITIES.
    7    2. PRESCRIBE STANDARDS AND CRITERIA FOR THE GRANTING  OF  APPLICATIONS
    8  FOR  LOANS  TO  EXPORT  TRADING ENTITIES AND FOR THE MAKING OF LOANS FOR
    9  ELIGIBLE PROJECTS. SUCH  STANDARDS  AND  CRITERIA  SHALL  IMPLEMENT  THE
   10  LEGISLATIVE FINDINGS AND PURPOSE SET FORTH IN THIS SUBTITLE. IN DEVELOP-
   11  ING  SUCH  STANDARDS  AND CRITERIA, THE AUTHORITY SHALL CONSULT WITH THE
   12  SUPERINTENDENT OF BANKS, THE SUPERINTENDENT OF INSURANCE AND THE COMMIS-
   13  SIONER OF ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT REGARDING STANDARDS AND CRITERIA FOR  THE
   14  MAKING  OF LOANS FOR AN ELIGIBLE PROJECT; TO PLAN, DEVELOP AND UNDERTAKE
   15  A PROGRAM WHEREIN SUCH LOANS FOR ELIGIBLE PROJECTS CAN BE  DISBURSED  TO
   16  THE  GENERAL  BUSINESS  COMMUNITY  OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK FOR ELIGIBLE
   17  PROJECTS.
   18    3. MAKE AND EXECUTE CONTRACTS FOR THE ADMINISTRATION OR  SERVICING  OF
   19  ANY  LOAN  MADE  BY THE AUTHORITY IN FURTHERANCE OF THIS SUBTITLE AND TO
   20  PAY THE REASONABLE VALUES OF SUCH SERVICES  RENDERED  TO  THE  AUTHORITY
   21  PURSUANT TO SUCH CONTRACT.
   22    4.  ACCESS FUNDS FOR THE PROMOTION OF THIS ACTIVITY AS DEFINED IN THIS
   23  SUBTITLE AND TO DO ALL THINGS REASONABLE TO DEVELOP  A  VIABLE  POOL  OF
   24  FUNDS  TO  CARRY  OUT THE LEGISLATIVE INTENT OF THIS SUBTITLE TO INCLUDE
   25  SEEKING OUT AND SECURING MONIES FROM THE SMALL BUSINESS  ADMINISTRATION,
   26  EXPORT-IMPORT  BANK  OF THE UNITED STATES, ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT ADMINIS-
   27  TRATION, AGENCY FOR INTERNATIONAL DEVELOPMENT, THE DEPARTMENT OF HOUSING
   28  AND URBAN DEVELOPMENT OR OTHER FEDERAL AGENCIES.
   29    5. DO ANY AND ALL THINGS NECESSARY OR CONVENIENT  TO  CARRY  OUT  THIS
   30  CORPORATE  PURPOSE  AND  EXERCISE  THE  POWERS GIVEN AND GRANTED IN THIS
   31  SUBTITLE.
   32    6. NOTWITHSTANDING ANY OF THE PROVISIONS OF THIS SUBTITLE, THE BORROW-
   33  ER MAY ONLY USE FUNDS MADE AVAILABLE BY THE AUTHORITY THROUGH LOANS  FOR
   34  ELIGIBLE  PROJECTS.  SPECIFICALLY,  THE  AUTHORITY SHALL NOT FINANCE THE
   35  SALE OF PRODUCTS OR SERVICES BEING EXPORTED AS PART OF  AN  EXPORT  SALE
   36  FROM THE UNITED STATES.
   37    S  1835-DD.  REPAYMENT  OF LOANS. 1. THE ENTIRE AMOUNT LOANED SHALL BE
   38  REPAID BY THE BORROWER TO THE AUTHORITY IN A TERM NOT  LONGER  THAN  ONE
   39  YEAR.
   40    2. INTEREST SHALL ACCRUE ON THE UNPAID BALANCE THROUGHOUT THE LIFETIME
   41  OF THE LOAN AT A RATE TO BE DETERMINED BY THE JOB DEVELOPMENT AUTHORITY.
   42    S  1835-EE.  RULES  AND REGULATIONS OF THE AUTHORITY. 1. THE AUTHORITY
   43  SHALL MAKE, PROMULGATE AND ENFORCE SUCH REASONABLE RULES AND REGULATIONS
   44  RELATING TO ITS DUTIES UNDER THIS SUBTITLE AS IT MAY DEEM APPROPRIATE.
   45    2. TO EFFECTUATE THE PURPOSE  OF  THIS  SUBTITLE,  THE  AUTHORITY  MAY
   46  REQUEST  FROM  ANY AUTHORITY, DIVISION, BOARD, BUREAU, COMMISSION OR ANY
   47  OTHER AGENCY OF THE STATE OR FROM ANY PUBLIC CORPORATION, AND  THE  SAME
   48  ARE  AUTHORIZED  TO  PROVIDE  SUCH SERVICES, ASSISTANCE AND DATA AS WILL
   49  ENABLE THE AUTHORITY TO PROPERLY CARRY OUT  ITS  FUNCTIONS,  POWERS  AND
   50  DUTIES UNDER THIS SUBTITLE.
   51    S 4. This act shall take effect on the one hundred twentieth day after
   52  it  shall have become a law. Effective immediately, the addition, amend-
   53  ment and/or repeal of any rule or regulation necessary for the implemen-
   54  tation of the foregoing sections of this act on their effective date  is
   55  authorized to be made on or before such effective date.
